metadata.Title: CVE-2018-4013 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
An exploitable code execution vulnerability exists in the HTTP packet-parsing functionality of the LIVE555 RTSP server library version 0.92. A specially crafted packet can cause a stack-based buffer overflow, resulting in code execution. An attacker can send a packet to trigger this vulnerability. It was discovered that liveMedia  incorrectly handled certain network packets. An attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary code.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-4013` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libbasicusageenvironment1 - 2018.10.17-1
libgroupsock8 - 2018.10.17-1
liblivemedia77 - 2018.10.17-1
libusageenvironment3 - 2018.10.17-1
livemedia-utils - 2018.10.17-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: liblivemedia package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2018.10.17-1').
